title: How to Fold Towels

steps.headline: Fold a washcloth into quarters.
steps.description: Washcloths are usually folded into quarters, by folding them in half one way and then into half the other way. They usually go unfolded or only folded in half if they are going to be hung up.

steps.headline: Fold a hand towel in half.
steps.description: Hand towels are usually hung up, and so they are only folded in half lengthwise. If you do not want the side seams to show, fold the long sides in so that they meet at the center and place the nice side facing outwards.

steps.headline: Fold a bath towel into thirds or quarters.
steps.description: It is best to fold bath towels as little as possible, so that they can properly dry (this will reduce the mold smell). If bath towels will be lain flat, such as on a shelf, they are usually folded into quarters, to preserve space. If they are going to be hung, they should generally be folded in half or into thirds.

steps.headline: Rolls towels for storage purposes.
steps.description: If you're wanting to store towels in a linen closet or suitcase, your best best is to roll them. This takes up the least amount of space. Simply start at one end and roll tightly all the way to the other.

steps.headline: Fold and hang the bath towel.
steps.description: Fold the bath towel into thirds and hang it as normal.

steps.description:

steps.headline: Fold the washcloth.
steps.description: Fold the washcloth back and forth like a fan and then fold it in half to create a decorative shape.

steps.headline: Hang the washcloth and hand towel.
steps.description: Hang the hand towel over the bath towel, And put some decorative ribbon or beads for a pleasant look.

steps.headline: Fold the hand towel into long quarters.
steps.description: Fold the long sides of the hand towel in to meet at the center, with one side slightly overlapping the other (like the sides of a buttoned shirt).

steps.headline: Fold the hand towel roughly in half.
steps.description: Fold the hand towel roughly in half (gap sides together), so that the front section is about 3-4" shorter than the other.

steps.headline: Create the collar.
steps.description: Flip the top section down over the top of the bottom section until a collar forms. Some adjusting may be needed to get it to look just perfect.

steps.headline: Make the tie.
steps.description:
Place washcloth on a flat surface diagonally, so that it makes a diamond shape. Then, fold the left and right corners in to the center and tuck the tips, so that a sort of burrito shape is formed. steps.headline: Tuck the tie.
steps.description: Tuck the tie into the shirt collar and place the whole thing on a bed, dresser, or other flat surface to display.
